meanings.definition: A unit of energy equal to the work done by a force of one newton acting through a distance of one meter.
meanings.sent1: She measured the energy in the battery in joules.
meanings.sent2: The light bulb used up several joules of energy.
meanings.sent3: The joule bounced around happily in the physics experiment.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm was like a joule, powering through the room.
meanings.sent5: The joule was the star of the energy show, shining brightly.

meanings.definition: The SI unit of work or energy, equal to the work done by a force of one newton when its point of application moves one meter in the direction of action of the force.
meanings.sent1: The student calculated the work done in joules for the science project.
meanings.sent2: The machine required a specific number of joules to operate efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The joule in the equation seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a joule, propelling her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The joule hummed with power, ready to be unleashed.
